graph.matching

Interface StrictAgent<X>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Agent<X>

    public interface StrictAgent<X>
extends Agent<X>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      A helper method to implement Agent.getPreferences, given that getPreferences is written.
      X[] getRankPreferences()
      Returns an array representing the preferences of this StrictAgent.
      static <X> java.util.List<X> perfersList(StrictAgent<X> a, X x)
      Returns the list of agents that a strictly prefers to x, in order of preference, with the highest ranked item coming first

      • Methods inherited from interface graph.matching.Agent

        getPreferences, isAcceptable, perfersSet, perfersWeaklySet, prefers, prefersWeakly

    • Method Detail

      • getRankPreferences

        X[] getRankPreferences()
        Returns an array representing the preferences of this StrictAgent. items appear in the array in the order that this prefers them in. Other items not in the array are unacceptable to this StrictAgent.
        a[0] > a[1] > a[2] > ... > a[n] > everything else

      • createPreferences

        static <X> java.util.Map<X,java.lang.Integer> createPreferences(StrictAgent<X> a)
        A helper method to implement Agent.getPreferences, given that getPreferences is written. Allows classes implementing StrictAgent to simply return createPreferences(this) for the getPreferences method. If preferences never change, this method can be called at construction time and the same map returned each call. The returned map is unmodifiable

      • perfersList

        static <X> java.util.List<X> perfersList(StrictAgent<X> a,
                                         X x)
        Returns the list of agents that a strictly prefers to x, in order of preference, with the highest ranked item coming first

      • perfersWeaklyList

        static <X> java.util.List<X> perfersWeaklyList(StrictAgent<X> a,
                                               X x)
        Returns the set of agents that a weakly prefers to x. Will contain x if x is acceptable to a.
